nodes.bodyText: Since we're here let's add the envoy_engine_t argument as well.
I wanted to be more selective in this PR and then have that in a subsequent one. wdyt @goaway?
@rebello95 I was not able how to import kEnvoySuccess here
If you @testable import EnvoyEngine it should work I believe
Should we use kEnvoySuccess in this file too?
Why is this implemented in Swift but not Kotlin?
nit: I'd drop this TODO for now - I'm not certain we do want to expose this publicly via a return code. (We can also throw an exception. Or log. Or do nothing.)

At this layer I'd have it return void. We don't currently expose Envoy return codes beyond the bridge layer elsewhere, and they're only return codes there because of a lack of a platform-agnostic way to signal success, if relevant.
